alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:14PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Clinton, northeastern Essex, northwestern Addison and southwestern Chittenden Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keene, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Essex, Willsboro, Westport, Elizabethtown, Monkton Ridge, Monkton, Monkton Boro, Williston, Au Sable Forks, Hinesburg, St. George, Starksboro, Jay In Essex County, Shelburne, Ferrisburg, Charlotte and Richmond. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 76 and 89. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern New York...and central and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Western Addison; Western Chittenden
